intro: Echinochloa crus-galli subsp. hostii, commonly known as broadleaf signalgrass, is a grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its broad, flat blades and a dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides, fields, and agricultural areas. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to reddish spikelets. The subspecies hostii is distinguished by its broader leaves and more robust growth compared to other forms of E. crus-galli.
